You're right.  It's a bug.  Only @DataPoint fields should be used.
Can you log the bug?  Thanks,

   David Saff

On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 3:47 AM, Raphael Parree <rparree@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Looking at the default data supplier for Theories (
> org.junit.experimental.theories.internal.AllMembersSupplier) it seems to me
> the @DataPoint annotation only has an effect on methods. If that is indeed
> the case perhaps the annotation should be defined with Target
> ElementType.METHOD?
>
> The reason is that the AllMembersSupplier's getValueSources uses the
> addFields which includes all public static fields regardless of any
> annotation (except for the plurar version DataPoints for arrays). Therefore
> it does not matter whether you use the @DataPoint annotation on fields.
> Perhaps the implementation of addFields should use it, in which case the
> target of the @DataPoint annotation should include fields.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Raphael
